definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看見你我太高興了，”嘉莉說，既高興又爲難。

sentences.english: LX, do you see in the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 樓下的，又看見你在上網了。

sentences.english: She gives me a big smile every time she sees me.
sentences.chinese: 她每次看見我都衝我熱情地笑笑。

sentences.english: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 凡住呂大和沙崙的人都看見了他，就歸服主。

sentences.english: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
sentences.chinese: 他看見彼得約翰將要進殿，就求他們賙濟。

sentences.english: Gog saw the gun and his face went white.
sentences.chinese: 高格看見了那支槍，臉色煞白。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he perceived a pale girl standing before him.
sentences.chinese: 他看見一個面色蠟黃的姑娘站在他面前。

sentences.english: The sailors took in sail when they saw the storm approach.
sentences.chinese: 水手們看見風暴快來了，就動手收帆。

sentences.english: Sitting at his toll booth one day, the publican saw Jesus approaching.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，馬太坐在稅關上，看見耶穌向他走來。

sentences.english: B:Did you see his last dive?
sentences.chinese: 他的最後一次跳水你看見了嗎？

sentences.english: She was found asleep on a pillow of leaves.
sentences.chinese: 有人看見她枕着樹葉睡着了。

sentences.english: He saw few problems with the division of Protestants into more and smaller denominations.
sentences.chinese: 他看見幾個問題與該司的新教徒更小面額的。

sentences.english: Expect to see more AI-based mobile technology quite soon.
sentences.chinese: 現在可以期待很快能看見更多的基於AI的移動技術。

sentences.english: I could see the greyish feathers of its flanks.
sentences.chinese: 我看見了它兩脅間斑白的羽毛。

sentences.english: One day he sees a beautiful bell at the top of a door.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他看見一戶人家的門頭有個很美麗的鈴鐺。

definition: to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to press charges/to file a complaint
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
